channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: U.S. companies could be caught in the crosshairs if China retaliates to fight Trump
item.description: China's retaliation tactics could range from economic changes to matters of diplomacy and security.

item.title: 'Political malpractice' if Trump undoes climate-geared Biden projects, outgoing U.S. energy secretary says
item.description: Outgoing U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm called for consistency in Washington's climate policies and global role in the green transition.

item.title: Super Micro faces deadline to keep Nasdaq listing after 85% plunge in stock
item.description: Super Micro could also get a reprieve and an extension from the Nasdaq, giving it months to come into compliance.

item.title: Disney is turning record parks profits — even before its big expansions
item.description: Disney is breaking ground on new additions and updates to its theme parks, but it will be several years before they become available to the public.

item.title: Argentina's Milei is a VIP at Mar-a-Lago as Trump, Musk embrace his attacks on government spending
item.description: President Javier Milei of Argentina has won support from Donald Trump and Elon Musk for his agenda of drastic government spending cuts.

item.title: GM lays off 1,000 employees amid reorganization, cost-cutting
item.description: The layoffs, which were announced Friday morning via email to those impacted, were across the business.

item.title: I became CEO of a company that has helped millions of kids read—here's my no. 1 piece of career advice
item.description: Dr. Geetha Murali is the CEO of Room to Read, a leading nonprofit organization with the mission to create a world free from illiteracy and gender inequality.

item.title: TikTok's 'Winter Arc’ challenge helps you get ahead of your New Year goals. Here’s why it’s gone viral and 4 tips to get started
item.description: The latest obsession on TikTok is the "Winter Arc" challenge, which sees young people get ahead of their New Year's Resolutions.

item.title: SpaceX president says 'there is plenty of room for competition,' as Starlink nears 5 million customers
item.description: SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell urged on rivals in comments Friday, describing competition as healthy for Elon Musk's space company.

item.title: World’s largest olive oil producer says ‘liquid gold’ prices on track to halve from record levels
item.description: Spain's Deoleo, the world's largest olive oil producer, says one of the most challenging moments in the industry's history appears to be drawing to a close.

item.title: Alibaba posts profit beat as China looks to prop up tepid consumer spend
item.description: The results come at a tricky time for Chinese commerce businesses, given the broad sluggishness in the world's second-largest economy.

item.title: Elon Musk's xAI raising up to $6 billion to purchase 100,000 Nvidia chips for Memphis data center
item.description: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI is raising up to $6 billion at a $50 billion valuation, according to CNBC's David Faber.

item.title: Former French president calls for a united Europe after Trump election win
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's election win last week has fueled fears of an impending economic nightmare for the European Union.

item.title: Japan GDP expands by 0.3% in third quarter, snapping two quarters of year-on-year declines
item.description: GDP rose 0.2% on a quarter-on-quarter basis, while also expanding 0.9% on an annualized basis.

item.title: UK economy surprises with September contraction, grows just 0.1% in the third quarter
item.description: The U.K. economy showed a surprise contraction in September and only marginal growth in the third quarter, initial figures showed Friday.

item.title: Asset manager says China's 'extreme valuations' look ideal for stock picking
item.description: Pzena Investment Management sees more opportunities in China and Japan.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Powell’s comments gave investors a reality check
item.description: Investors riding high on the postelection rally and are now dragged down to earth by interest rate concerns, their landing sure feels like a bumpy one.

item.title: Powell says the Fed doesn't need to be 'in a hurry' to reduce interest rates
item.description: "The strength we are currently seeing in the economy gives us the ability to approach our decisions carefully," Powell said.

item.title: Hyundai names North American exec Jose Munoz as CEO, effective Jan. 1
item.description: Hyundai Motor Co. on Thursday named Jose Munoz as the next president and CEO of the South Korean automaker, effective Jan. 1.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Powell’s comments drag investors down to earth from postelection high
item.description: Investors riding high on the postelection rally and are now dragged down to earth by interest rate concerns, their landing sure feels like a bumpy one.

item.title: India’s central bank chief warns growing risk of global inflation returning
item.description: Central banks have managed to engineer a soft landing, but there is still a risk of global inflation returning, according to India's central bank chief.

item.title: Bookings for Disney's first cruise in Asia are opening soon. Here's how much the trip costs
item.description: The Disney Adventure starts at $958 for two people, but rates go higher for those who want ocean views, verandahs and "Frozen" themed suites.

item.title: Trump victory drives gold to near 2-month lows as investors pile into equities, cryptocurrencies
item.description: The recent slide — gold has declined in six of the seven sessions since Trump's victory — follows a series of record-breaking milestones for bullion over the past year.

item.title: The season's hottest gift? A travel 'experience' — here's how to buy one
item.description: Travel is hard to give to others, according to a new Accenture survey. CNBC Travel explores several ways to get around the hardest problems.

item.title: Trump picks vaccine skeptic RFK Jr. for Health and Human Services secretary
item.description: Donald Trump had said that if elected president he would have Robert F. Kennedy Jr. "go wild on health." HHS oversees Medicare, Medicaid, the CDC and the FDA.

item.title: Trump attorney general pick Matt Gaetz under scrutiny as House Ethics report on sex and drug claims takes focus
item.description: GOP Sen. John Cornyn said he "absolutely" wants to see the House Ethics Committee report on Matt Gaetz, President-elect Donald Trump's attorney general pick.

item.title: Embattled fashion house Burberry reveals massive overhaul sending shares to an all-time high
item.description: Burberry is aiming to boost waning sales by refocusing on heritage designs and statement pieces under sweeping revamp plans announced Thursday.

item.title: Disney earnings offer hope that streaming can successfully supplant linear TV
item.description: Disney projects entertainment direct-to-consumer operating income will increase by about $875 million next year over fiscal year 2024.

item.title: Trump may cede global climate leadership to China
item.description: As Republicans eye a red sweep, the U.S. could announce its withdrawal from the Paris Agreement as soon as early 2025 and complete it by beginning of 2026.

item.title: Here's the deflation breakdown for October 2024 — in one chart
item.description: There are still some pockets of deflation in the U.S. economy, though the dynamic has become more muted as supply chains normalize, economists said.
